subject: p15192710
Impression: PA and lateral chest compared to. Left apical pneumothorax is tiny if any. The benefit of the lateral view. We can see that although the large region of opacification in the left lower lung is improving. There are actually two responsible abnormalities, a region of consolidation or atelectasis in the lingula, and a pleural collection in the left lower hemithorax adjacent to region of consolidation. One or both of these lesions is presumably a hematoma from recent transbronchial biopsy. PA and lateral views therefore are recommended for subsequent followup. Right lung is clear. The heart is normal size.
